I'm doing rather well, thank you. How are things with you?

What kind of bread are you making?
It's a sourdough rye this time. Trying to perfect the tang
Sometimes! Not always though. It depends on the mood. How about you, are you a caraway fan?
I kind of like them in bread, but not too much. How about you?
I like them, but just a touch. Too much can be overpowering.
I agree. They can be a bit much!
Yeah, a little goes a long way. What's something you're baking these days?
I've been experimenting with some lavender shortbread cookies lately.
Oh, those sound lovely! I've never tried baking with lavender before. What made you want to experiment with that flavor?
"I've been wanting to try something a little different than usual. Plus, lavender is very calming, so I thought it might make for a relaxing treat."
That's interesting! Do you have any other favorite herbs or spices you like to bake with?
I like using rosemary in scones, it adds a nice savory note.
Rosemary sounds lovely in scones! I've never thought to use it. Do you have any other savory herb and spice pairings you like?
"Thyme and lemon zest are amazing in shortbread cookies! The thyme adds a subtle earthy note, and the lemon zest brightens everything up."
Wow, thyme and lemon? That's a really unique combination. I'll have to try that!
"Let me know if you want the recipe! I've been tweaking it for a while and I think it's pretty good."
"That's so generous of you, thank you! I'd love to give it a try."
I'm happy to share! Just let me know if you need any help with substitutions or anything.
That's great to know, thanks! I might need some help with finding a good substitute for something, I'm not fully stocked
"What are you missing? Maybe I can suggest a swap based on what you have."
"I'm out of lemon zest, what would you recommend as a good replacement?"
"Orange zest would be a good substitute for lemon zest! It has a similar bright citrus flavor.
That's a great idea! Thanks so much!
"Just be sure to use a little less orange zest, as it can be a bit stronger than lemon. "
Got it, thanks! I'll keep that in mind.
"Sounds like you've got it covered! Happy baking!"
Thanks again! I'll let you know how it turns out!
That's the spirit! Enjoy the process
"I will! Can't wait to see how it turns out!
"If you're feeling adventurous, I can share my recipe for lavender shortbread cookies. They're surprisingly delicious!
"Those sound lovely! I've never tried baking with lavender before. What made you want to experiment with that flavor?
"I've been wanting to try something a little different than usual. Plus, lavender is very calming, so I thought it might make for a relaxing treat."
That makes sense. I can see how baking with calming scents would make the experience more enjoyable
"It's really quite versatile! You can use it in cakes, cookies, even savory dishes. Have you ever tried cooking with herbs before?"
That's interesting! Do you have any other favorite herbs or spices you like to bake with?
"I like using rosemary in scones, it adds a nice savory note."
Rosemary sounds lovely in scones! I'd love to try that. Do you have any tips for using it?
"Just a teaspoon or so, depending on how strong you like the flavor. You could also infuse the butter with rosemary before adding it to the dough for a more pronounced taste."
"That's a great tip! I might have to try that this weekend."
"I sometimes add a sprinkle of sugar on top before baking for a little extra sweetness.
"Ooh, that's smart. I bet it gives a nice little crunch too.
"Let me know if you want to try out a rosemary scone recipe together sometime! I have a pretty good one. "
"That sounds like fun! I'd love to try it."
